Hi @vladimir_culic, I think that with the OData adapter, your payload should look something like this:

<A_SalesOrderItem>
	<A_SalesOrderItemType>

	</A_SalesOrderItemType>

entry.title: Re: Safe quantities in orders from being rescheduled?
entry.content:
Yes SAP does give you ways to ‚Äúprotect‚Äù certain sales order items from being touched by the nightly rescheduling run (SDV03V02 / V_V2), so that they keep their original confirmed quantities and dates.

Go to your sales order ‚Üí Item ‚Üí Shipping tab ‚Üí field Fix qty/date. If this flag is set, the rescheduling program will not change the confirmed quantity or date for that schedule line. Perfect for presold or ‚Äúexit‚Äù products where you want to honour the original confirmation (first‚Äëcome, first‚Äëserved).

entry.title: Re: Custom Action on SAP BTP Build Process Automation
entry.content:
Hello @Rawel 

Thank you for your question. 

Base on your screenshots i can see you are trying to post attachments using the API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV service. The error you are experiencing is expected because the attachment content set itself is only meant to read available content and does not expose a POST method.

To post attachments you must use the attachment set entity, the payload must include metada containing binary content.

The following references provide more details

Technical name: API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV

Access Fiori apps via SAP Build Work Zone Site with Federated SAP S/4HANA Content

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP BDC Trial System takes long time for setup
entry.content: I too faced same issue for almost a week. Then I realized my browser my S user account logged in. I would request you to please log off from your S user account and relogin with your trial account login. This works.

entry.title: How to use MessageManager in SAPUI5 - Step-by-Step Guide
entry.content:
What is MessageManager?

The MessageManager in SAPUI5 helps us to manage and display messages like errors, warnings, or informational notes in our application. These messages often appear in a MessagePopover or directly next to form fields, giving users real-time feedback.

Let‚Äôs go through step by step to understand how we can use MessageManager effectively in our SAPUI5 app.

 

Step 1: Register the View with MessageManager

Before displaying any messages, we need to register our view with the MessageManager. This tells SAPUI5 to monitor form fields and automatically bind any messages to the right controls.

Add this line in the init function of our Component.js (or) Main.view.xml:

sap.ui.getCore().getMessageManager().registerObject(this.getView(), true);

Screenshot 1.1

Please Note: If  we're using manifest.json, there's also a declarative way to register it, but for simplicity, we‚Äôre going with manual registration here.

 

Step 2: Add a MessagePopover Control

To show the messages visually, add a MessagePopover in our view. We can do this in XML or JavaScript.

XML Example:

<Button text="Show Messages" press="onOpenMessagePopover" />

Screenshot 1.2.1

Please Note: Just for your understanding, as per the screenshot, I have used Main.view.xml for button which could trigger the validation based on the user input on this form fields.

<MessagePopover id="messagePopover" items="{ path: '/messages' }">
    <items>
        <MessageItem type="{type}" title="{message}" 
            description="{description}" />
    </items>
</MessagePopover>

Screenshot 1.2.2

Please Note: Just for your understanding, as per the screenshot, I have used separate fragment for for MessagePopover which could pop up when while validation has been called off.

 

Step 3: Add Messages to the MessageManager

Whenever we want to show a message (e.g., an error if a form field is empty), use the addMessages() method:

sap.ui.getCore().getMessageManager().addMessages(
    new sap.ui.core.message.Message({
        message: "Please fill all required fields.",
        type: sap.ui.core.MessageType.Error,
        target: "/field", // Optional: bind to a specific field
        processor: this.getView().getModel()
    })
);

Screenshot 1.3

Please Note: Just for your understanding, as per the screenshot, I have used separate method as addErrorMessage to add dynamic error messages for multiple forms.

Available Message Types:

  • Error
  • Warning
  • Success
  • Information

 

Step 4: Open the MessagePopover

When the user clicks the button (or at the right moment in our flow), open the MessagePopover:

onOpenMessagePopover: function (oEvent) {
    if (!this._oMessagePopover) {
        this._oMessagePopover = this.byId("messagePopover");
    }
    this._oMessagePopover.openBy(oEvent.getSource());
}

Screenshot 1.4

Please Note: Just for your understanding, as per the screenshot, I have used separate fragment for for MessagePopover which could pop up when Button has been triggered. (ex. while user clicks the submit button without filling the mandatory fields)

 

Step 5: Clear Messages

If needed (e.g., after a successful save), we can clear all messages like this:

sap.ui.getCore().getMessageManager().removeAllMessages();

Screenshot 1.5

Please Note: Just for your understanding, as per the screenshot, I have used separate method as removeErrorMessage to remove dynamic error messages.

 

Complete Flow - Here‚Äôs the full flow in a nutshell:

  1. Register our view with the MessageManager
  2. Add a MessagePopover control
  3. Insert messages into the MessageManager
  4. Trigger the MessagePopover on user interaction
  5. Clear messages when appropriate

 

Complete Code: (For Reference)

MessageManager.controller.js

sap.ui.define([
  "./BaseController",
  "sap/ui/core/message/Message",
  "sap/ui/core/Fragment"
],

  function (BaseController, Message, Fragment) {
    "use strict";

    return BaseController.extend("testapp.controller.MessageManager", {
      onInit: function () {
        var oMessageManager, oView;
        oView = this.getView();

        oMessageManager = sap.ui.getCore().getMessageManager();
        oView.setModel(oMessageManager.getMessageModel(), "message");

        oMessageManager.registerObject(oView, true);
      },

      onOpenMessagePopover: function (oEvent) {
        var oSource = oEvent.getSource();

        this._createMessagePopover().then(function (oMessagePopover) {
          oMessagePopover.openBy(oSource);
        });
      },

      _createMessagePopover: function (oEvent) {

        var oView = this.getView();

        if (!this._pMessagePopover) {
          this._pMessagePopover = Fragment.load({
            id: oView.getId(),
            name: "testapp.fragment.MessagePopover"
          }).then(function (oMessagePopover) {
            oView.addDependent(oMessagePopover);
            return oMessagePopover;
          });
        }
        return this._pMessagePopover;
      },

      addErrorMessage: function (sMessage, sTarget) {
        var oMessage = new Message({
          message: sMessage,
          type: MessageType.Error,
          target: sTarget,
          processor: this.oModel,
          activeTitle: true
        });
        sap.ui.getCore().getMessageManager().addMessages(oMessage);
      },

      removeErrorMessages: function () {
        sap.ui.getCore().getMessageManager().removeAllMessages(
          new Message({
            target: "/uiDataInput",
            processor: this.oModel
          })
        );
      },

      onContinue: function (oEvent) {
        const oSource = oEvent.getSource();
        if (!this.uiOrderFieldValidation()) {
          oSource.setBusy(true);
          Promise.resolve().finally(() => {
            oSource.setBusy(false);
          });
        }
      },

      uiOrderFieldValidation: function () {
        let bOrderHasErrors = false;
        this.removeErrorMessages();
        const oResourceBundle = this.getOwnerComponent().getModel("i18n").getResourceBundle();

        var sErrorMessage = oResourceBundle.getText("ORDER_FORM_ERROR_MESSAGE_GENERAL");
        const sFirstName = this.oModel.getProperty("/uiDataInput/firstname");
        if (!sFirstName || sFirstName.trim().length === 0) {
          const sNameErrorMessage = oResourceBundle.getText("ORDER_FORM_ERROR_MESSAGE_USER_FIRSTNAME");
          this.addErrorMessage(sNameErrorMessage, "/uiDataInput/firstName");
          sErrorMessage = sNameErrorMessage;
          bOrderHasErrors = true;
        }

        const sLastName = this.oModel.getProperty("/uiDataInput/lastName");
        if (!sLastName || sLastName.trim().length === 0) {
          const sLastNameErrorMessage = oResourceBundle.getText("ORDER_FORM_ERROR_MESSAGE_USER_LASTNAME");
          this.addErrorMessage(sLastNameErrorMessage, "/uiDataInput/lastName");
          sErrorMessage = sLastNameErrorMessage;
          bOrderHasErrors = true;
        }

        //Similarly you can check for all the remaining fields

        return bOrderHasErrors;
      }

    });
  });

 

MessageManager.view.xml

<mvc:View controllerName="testapp.controller.MessageManager"
    xmlns:mvc="sap.ui.core.mvc" displayBlock="true"
    xmlns:core="sap.ui.core"
    xmlns:l="sap.ui.layout"
    xmlns:u="sap.ui.table"
    xmlns:f="sap.ui.layout.form"
    xmlns="sap.m">
    <Page class="sapUiSizeCompact sapUiContentPadding" showHeader="false">
        <Panel headerText="Validation check using Message Manager" backgroundDesign="Transparent"
            class="sapUiSmallMarginBottom">
            <f:SimpleForm backgroundDesign="Transparent" editable="true"
                layout="ResponsiveGridLayout" labelSpanL="3" labelSpanM="3"
                labelSpanS="12" adjustLabelSpan="true" emptySpanXL="0" emptySpanL="0" emptySpanM="0"
                emptySpanS="0" columnsL="1" columnsM="1"
                singleContainerFullSize="false">

                <f:content>
                    <Label text="First Name" required="true" />
                    <Input type="Text" width="18.5em" maxLength="30"
                        value="{path: 'globalModel>/uiDataInput/firstName', 
                                    type: 'sap.ui.model.type.String', 
                                    constraints: { minLength: 1, maxLength: 30 }}" />

                    <Label text="Last Name" required="true" />
                    <Input type="Text" width="18.5em" maxLength="30"
                        value="{path: 'globalModel>/uiDataInput/lastName', 
                                    type: 'sap.ui.model.type.String', 
                                    constraints: { minLength: 1, maxLength: 30 }}" />
                    </HBox>
                    <Label text="Contact Number" required="true" />
                    <HBox>
                        <HBox width="27em" justifyContent="End">
                            <Input type="Number" width="25em" maxLength="30"
                                value="{path: 'globalModel>/uiDataInput/contactNumber', 
                                        type: 'sap.ui.model.type.String', 
                                        constraints: { minLength: 1, maxLength: 30 }}" />
                        </HBox>
                    </HBox>
                    <Label text="Email Address" />
                    <HBox>
                        <HBox width="27em" justifyContent="End">
                            <Input width="25em" maxLength="241"
                                value="{path: 'globalModel>/uiDataInput/emailID', 
                                        type: 'sap.ui.model.type.String', 
                                        constraints: { minLength: 1, maxLength: 241 }}" />
                        </HBox>
                    </HBox>
                    <Label text="Address" />
                    <TextArea height="7em"
                        value="{globalModel>/uiDataInput/address}"
                        rows="3"
                        width="25em"
                        liveChange="onTextAreaLiveChange"
                    />
                </f:content>
            </f:SimpleForm>
        </Panel>


        <Toolbar>
            <Button text="BACK" visible="false"
                class="sapUiSmallMarginBegin sapUiMediumMarginTopBottom"
                type="Emphasized" press=".navToOverview" />
            <ToolbarSpacer />
            <Button
                icon="sap-icon://alert"
                text="{= ${message>/}.length }"
                visible="{= ${message>/}.length > 0 }"
                type="Emphasized"
                press=".onOpenMessagePopover" />
            <Button text="NEXT"
                class="sapUiTinyMarginEnd sapUiMediumMarginTopBottom"
                type="Emphasized" press="onContinue" />
        </Toolbar>
    </Page>
</mvc:View>

 

MessagePopover.fragment.xml

<core:FragmentDefinition
    xmlns="sap.m"
    xmlns:core="sap.ui.core">
    <MessagePopover
        items="{message>/}"
        initiallyExpanded="true"
        activeTitlePress=".onActiveTitlePressed">
        <MessageItem
            activeTitle="true"
            type="{message>type}"
            title="{message>message}"
            subtitle="{message>additionalText}"
            description="{message>description}"/>
    </MessagePopover>
</core:FragmentDefinition>

 

Real World Scenario

Let‚Äôs say a user submits a form without filling all the required fields:

  1. You add error messages to the MessageManager.
  2. The messages automatically link to the empty fields.
  3. When the user clicks Show Messages, the MessagePopover displays all the issues clearly.
  4. After correcting the errors, you can clear all messages and proceed.

Thank you for taking the time to read this blog! 

If you found this helpful, feel free to share your thoughts, feedback or questions in the comments! Let's keep learning and growing together. 

Dear experts, I‚Äôm new to blogging, please feel free to correct me if any information is inaccurate.

entry.title: Unlocking End-to-End Change Transparency with DocFlow Reporting by Ovee
entry.content:
Motivation

In today‚Äôs complex SAP and hybrid IT landscapes, organizations face increasing pressure to maintain visibility and control over changes, ensure audit readiness, and accelerate delivery. While SAP Solution Manager has long provided powerful tools such as ChaRM (Change Request Management) and ITSM, many customers encountered two persistent challenges:

  • Difficulty accessing specific ticket details hidden in technical tables.
  • Lack of a global overview of change across systems and workflows.

DocFlow Reporting was created to address these gaps ‚Äî providing extensive visibility, simplified reporting, and automated audit readiness.

How does DocFlow fit into the transition to Cloud ALM?

As customers transition from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM, the challenge is not only to embrace new change management capabilities but also to retain access to historical ChaRM data for audits.

DocFlow Reporting bridges this gap with an archiving solution that secures past ticket information while preparing for the future.

At the same time, we are developing the next generation of DocFlow, designed to integrate seamlessly with Cloud ALM, S/4HANA, and JIRA. This evolution ensures customers benefit from continuity, scalability, and a broader ecosystem reach, taking DocFlow Reporting to the next level in alignment with SAP‚Äôs strategic direction.

Process Explanation: Managing Change with SAP ChaRM & Beyond

Every change in an SAP landscape starts as a request, evolves through approval, and is ultimately deployed into production. Along the way, stakeholders need clarity on:

  • Incidents and Requests for Change triggering the change process.
  • Normal, Standard, or Urgent Changes governed by ChaRM.
  • Transport Requests linked to technical deployments and their current position in the landscape.
  • External references such as SAP Notes, SolDoc elements, or tickets from third-party tools.

Traditionally, this information was fragmented across multiple modules. With DocFlow Reporting, users gain a single, consolidated overview of all changes, their dependencies, and their execution status.

Solution & Value Description

DocFlow Reporting delivers value in three main areas:

1. Visibility & Control

  • End-to-end traceability of all change documents and associated transport requests
  • Visualization of each transport position in the system landscape.
  • Dual landscape management with Retrofit transparency and Predict Retrofit analysis.
  • Easy access to Attachments from Change Documents and External Reference

DocFlow allows to have an extensive visibility on all ongoing and past changes accross SAP Solution Landscapes. At a glance, you can review Change Documents and associated Transport Requests including visualization of their position in the Landscape.

 Tracking end-to-end change management process is possible from change initiated in third-party tool up to the deployment in the Production System.

In addition, in case of running a Dual Landscape using Retrofit, transparency on the Retrofit process is given in DocFlow (Retrofit Status) as well as a Predict Retrofit that allows to check Retrofit Categorization for objects before the original Transport Request has been released.

If attachments are available in the Change Document or the related ticket in third party tool, DocFlow makes it easy to review then facilitating the change review.

 2. Audit Readiness

  • Automated extraction for audits, including PDF change records, CSV extracts, linked transport requests with timestamps, and attachments .
  • Easy justification for compliance and IT audit trails.

Collecting Justification for Audit trails has never been easier. With DocFlow it is possible to easily schedule an extraction that can then be downloaded.

Each extraction contains:

  • A pdf file for each Change Document that matches the selection criteria
  • A folder for each Change Document containing the attachments and even external attachments (e.g. coming from JIRA, if any) 
  • A csv file containing the extract of the result screen of the DocFlow
  • A csv containing the list of transport requests (if any) linked to the Change Document that matches the selection criteria along with their export and import timestamp for each system in the landscape

With JIRA integration it can also extract the content of the related JIRA ticket in html format making audit trail even easier.

 3. Flexibility & Extensibility

With DocFlow, you gain the flexibility to focus on the information that really matters and is tailored to your specific needs. It offers:

  • Customizable views: users can select fields and filters that matter most .
  • Variants to save and reuse reporting configurations.
  • Export options to Excel, CSV, and HTML for broader use.
  • Out of the box extensibility to display and filter customer specific fields.

Architecture

The current generation of DocFlow integrates natively with SAP Solution Manager ChaRM & ITSM as well as with third party tools such as JIRA and Service Now.

The next generation, already in development, is designed to:

  • Consume data from multiple sources: SAP Cloud ALM, SAP S/4HANA, JIRA and other third-party systems
  • Provide a reporting layer, ensuring continuity during the transition from SolMan to CALM.
  • Support hybrid scenarios, where historical ChaRM data must remain accessible for audits while new change management processes run in Cloud ALM.

Go-To-Market Plan

  • Today: DocFlow Reporting is fully available for SAP Solution Manager customers. It secures investments in ChaRM & ITSM while simplifying audits and accelerating project delivery.
  • 2025‚Äì2026: SAP will deliver extended change management features in Cloud ALM. In parallel, Ovee is building the next-generation DocFlow, designed for multi-source integration (CALM, S/4HANA, JIRA).
  • Future: Customers will benefit from continuity, scalability, and innovation ‚Äî moving seamlessly from SolMan-based change management to a unified, modern reporting solution aligned with SAP‚Äôs strategic direction .

Conclusion

Change transparency is no longer optional ‚Äî it is a requirement for agility, compliance, and trust. With DocFlow Reporting, organizations gain:

  • Clear, consolidated views across change processes.
  • Faster, simpler audit preparation.
  • A future-proof solution that evolves with SAP Cloud ALM, S/4HANA, and JIRA.

üëâWhether you are still running SAP Solution Manager or already transitioning to Cloud ALM, DocFlow ensures your change reporting remains robust, audit-ready, and aligned with tomorrow‚Äôs SAP landscape.

entry.title: How to approve/reject tasks directly in SAP Mobile Start app (s/4hana cloud public edition)
entry.content:
Hello,

We have integrated SAP S/4HANA Cloud with SAP Mobile Start through SAP Build Work Zone.
The purchaser and purchasing manager roles have been exposed to BTP and assigned in Build Work Zone.

After completing all notification-related configurations, we are able to receive purchase requisition approval tasks both on the mobile device and on the Build Work Zone home page.

However, to actually approve or reject a task, we still need to navigate to the tenant and process it there.

Is there a way to handle these approval/rejection actions directly from the SAP Mobile Start app without navigating to the tenant?

Thanks in advance for your guidance.

entry.title: Steps to Connect Eclipse ADT with GITHUB
entry.content:
Introduction: By linking Eclipse ADT with GitHub developers can manage source code, collaborate remotely and adopt best practices in enterprise development workflows using Git repositories.

‚ùñ Prerequisites
‚ñ™ Eclipse ADT set up in ABAP Perspective.
‚ñ™ ABAP Package created (to link with GitHub)
‚ñ™ GitHub account and Repository.

‚ùë Stage 1 - Install abapGit plugin in Eclipse
1. Open Eclipse and select Help ‚Üí Install New Software.

2. Enter the abapGit URL https://eclipse.abapgit.org/updatesite/
the ‚Äòwork with‚Äô section, press enter ‚Üí select abapGit forABAP
Development Tools (ADT) ‚Üí click Next.

3. Click Finish.

4. Click Select All ‚Üí Trust Selected.

5. Click Restart Now.

abapGit plugin is installed now in Eclipse ADT


‚ùë Stage 2 - Create GitHub Personal Access Token
1. Open GitHub repository you want to link with your
ABAP package ‚Üí copy the repository URL (you will use
it in the next stage) ‚Üí go to Settings (click your profile
picture in the top-right corner to access it).

2. In Settings, open Developer settings (bottom of the sidebar) ‚Üí
expand Personal access tokens ‚Üí click Tokens (classic).

3. click Generate new token ‚Üí click Generate new token(classic).

4. Provide a Note (descriptive name) for the token ‚Äì set an
expiration period ‚Äì select the required scopes (choose repo to
enable general repository push and pull operations).

5. scroll the page down ‚Üí click Generate token.

6. PAT successfully generated ‚Üí copy the token (you‚Äôll use in next
stage).

‚ùë Stage 3 ‚Äì Link GitHub Repository with ABAP
Package, Commit Changes, and Push files
1. Open Eclipse ‚Üí select Window ‚Üí Show View ‚Üí Other

2. Search ‚Äòabapgit‚Äô ‚Üí select abapGit Repositories ‚Üí click Open

3. Under abapGit Repositories view, click ‚Äò+‚Äô icon (Link New
abapGit Repository).

4. Paste GitHub Repository URL (copied in Stage 2 ‚Äì Step 1) ‚Üí
click Next.

5. Add Package Name ‚Üí click Next ‚Üí select Folder Logic
(default Full) ‚Üí click Finish.

6. Click My Repositories ‚Üí right-click on your package ‚Üí click
Stage and Push.

7. In the abapGit Staging view ‚Üí (1) refresh to load the updated
objects ‚Üí (2) select the object(s) ‚Üí (3) click ‚Äò+‚Äô icon to Stage
them ‚Üí (4) enter a Commit Message (optional) ‚Üí (5) click
Commit and Push.

8. Enter your GitHub account credentials (Username and
Password/Token generated in Stage 2 ‚Äì Step 6). Tick Store in
Secure Store to save the credentials with your ABAP package
‚Üí click OK ‚Üí in the Push Started dialog box, click OK again.

Successfully Connected Eclipse ADT with Github

Benefits:-

  • Version Control: Track all changes efficiently, facilitating rollbacks and history audits.
  • Collaboration: Enables multiple SAP developers to work together remotely using branches and pull requests.
  • Code Quality: Supports code reviews and integration with AI tools like Copilot for BAP.
  • Learning and Documentation: Provides a rich environment for reviewing, documenting and explaining code.

Conclusion: By connecting Eclipse ADT with GitHub, SAP ABAP developers again a robust, collaborative environment with modern version control and productivity features. Applying these steps accelerates development, improves code quality and equips teams to meet enterprise standards in ABAP project delivery.

entry.title: Steps for Generating the SAML Assertion to read the data from the Successfactors using IAS
entry.content:
SAP recommends using OAuth 2.0 authentication for API integrations, as HTTP Basic Authentication is deprecated.

In the context of SuccessFactors OData APIs, OAuth 2.0 authentication relies on the SAML 2.0 Bearer Assertion flow. This approach requires an external Identity Provider (IdP), such as SAP Identity Authentication Service (IAS), to generate a signed SAML assertion. That assertion is then exchanged for an OAuth access token, which is used to authenticate API requests to the SAP SuccessFactors system.

Prerequisites

Before implementing the flow, ensure that:

  • SAP SuccessFactors is federated with SAP IAS.

  • A SuccessFactors API user is created, using the same username in both SuccessFactors and IAS.

  • A copy of the SAP IAS signing certificate is available (to be uploaded to SuccessFactors for trust configuration).

Steps :

Please follow the steps below to configure and use it seamlessly . 

Steps for Generating the SAML Assertion to read the data from the Successfactors using IAS for Integration.

  1. Take the SSO certificate from the IAS tenant

Go to Application and resources and choose tenant Settings:

Click on the Single Sign-on Tab and navigate the SAML 2.O Configuration:

Click on the signing Certificates and copy the certificate to register the OAUTH application in Manage OAuth2 Client Applications in Successfactors.

Click on the Binoculars and copy the certificate to use it while registering the Application in Successfactors.

  1. Login to SuccessFactors and go to the Manage OAuth2 Client Applications in Successfactors.

Name

Value

Company

Successfactors instance company id

Application Name

Any Name which is relevant for your integration

Description

Any description

Application URL

Give the application url for which you are going to use this set up.

Bind to users

SFADMIN (or any other API users having admin permissions)

x.509 certificate

IAS tenant setting Signing certificate copy and paste here

API key

It will generate automatically, and we will use it at later point of time so keep it handy

 

  1. Go to IAS and navigate to the application and Resources and choose application.

Create two applications here in IAS system.

  1. OIDC to generate the IAS token having name OIDCTOKEN
  2. SuccessFactors OAuth Integration for generating the token for Successfactors to read the SF data.

 

  1. Go the applications and create and name the applications as OIDCTOKEN.

Application is created as shown below:

Configure the OIDC application to allow password and token exchange: For that you need to click on the OpenID connect configuration.

Keep the grant Types as password and Token exchange (RFC 8693) and save it.

Create secret for the OIDC application and Copy Client ID and Client Secret for later use

Scroll down, copy the client and add the client secret as shown below:

Click on ADD and use the below details to configure and save it.

Client ID and secret will be generated, kindly keep it for later use.

Example of client id and secret!

Client ID: 8b351919-d729-4c6e-ab73-f78d123456

Client Secret: VHJOqEJu4IA2hyA[KzUnm12hr58754

After clicking on OK.

  1. Under Applications & Resources > Applications > Create, create a new application for SF with SAML 2.0 as Protocol Type and the application Name will be SuccessFactors OAuth Integration

Under SAML 2.0 Configuration tab, set the Name field/Entity ID to any you wish and add the SF token endpoint (https:///oauth/token) . In our case the token URL will be https://api2preview.sapsf.eu/oauth/token

NOTE: Do not use existing SF application because special settings are required for OAUTH that is why we are creating a new application here.

Under Subject Name Identifier tab, select Basic Configuration option and set the basic attribute to Login Name:

Under Attributes tab, remove the "user_uuid" attribute and add the "api_key" attribute, setting its Source to Expression and Value to the API key previously copied from Successfactors while configuring Manage Oauth2 application in Successfactors.

Under Provided APIs tab, switch on the "Allow all APIs for principal propagation" option:

Now go back to the OIDCTOKEN applications and add the dependencies as shown below.

Click on ADD and you will be able to add the below values.

Click on Save:

Testing the configuration:

  1.  Triggering API calls to get tokens and data using Postman: The third-party system can use the APIs details and connect to Successfactors using token generation.
  2. The parameters and credentials which needs to be passed to generate the token from IAS. 

 Call IAS endpoint /oauth2/token with target username and password to get access token and ID token for target user. Use Client ID and Secret previously generated in IAS as User and Password for Basic Authentication:

Name

Value

URL for generating the token

https://<IAS tenant ID>.accounts.ondemand.com/oauth2/token in our case. In general, you can take the specific IAS URL for each system.

Header Name: Content-Type

application/x-www-form-urlencoded

Header Name: Authorization

This should be generated as base-64 encoding in the format clientID:Secret on the website https://www.base64encode.org/ The clientID and secret value you should take it from the OIDCTOKEN application step where we have generated the secret and ClientID while configuring in IAS. The value will be Basic <Base64 encoded Value>                        

 

 

  

 

Parameter Name: grant_type

Password (this text password will be used and don‚Äôt look for any password)

Parameter Name: username

SFADMIN

Parameter Name: password

The password we need setup for this user SFADMIN in IAS and for the first time you should login to IAS with the new password and it will ask you to reset it. Use the new Password and maintain the same password.

 

Please see the screenshot from Postman.

Parameters:

Headers:

entry.title: Delivery Failed Scenario or Futile Deliveries Scenario with SAP Transportation Management
entry.content:
Delivery Failed Scenario or Futile Deliveries Scenario with SAP Transportation Management

Futile deliveries or deliveries failed scenario is majorly seen with the retail companies where in the B2C scenario with outbound transportation sometimes driver or delivery person could not deliver the goods , due to customer is not available to receive the goods.

If such situation arises there following possible action could be:

  • Inform the same driver or delivery person to redeliver the goods again (keep the shipment until shipment is delivered)
  • Inform the driver or delivery person to return the goods to the source location and plan it again to deliver.

To handle the situation mentioned above SAP Transportation management provides out of the box solution options. These solution options also depend on whether you want to settle the cost of the failed delivery attempt.

Let‚Äôs consider we have the below stages in the freight order

and items tab looks like below:

Now for example delivery attempt failed with the customer location ‚ÄúUSCU-SCE03‚Äù.

To handle delivery failed situation choose the Hierarchy to ‚ÄúStatus Management‚Äù in the Item tab of the respective freight document.

It provides the below options and shows above in the screen shot:

a) Retry Delivery

Select the package(goods) which was not delivered and choose the option ‚ÄúRetry Delivery‚Äù and this will duplicate the original stage. In this case freight unit still belongs to the same freight order the cost of the delivery attempt can be calculated.

In this case since customer ‚ÄúUSCU-SCE03‚Äù was not available to receive the goods, driver move to next customer location i.e. ‚ÄúUSCU-SCE02‚Äù and retry to deliver the customer location ‚ÄúUSCU-SCE03‚Äù again after delivering the customer ‚Äú‚ÄúUSCU-SCE02‚Äù, that is why a new stage has been added to the stages from customer location ‚ÄúUSCU-SCE02‚Äù to customer location ‚ÄúUSCU-SCE03‚Äù.

b)Return to Loading Location

Select the package(goods) which was not delivered and choose the option ‚ÄúReturn to Loading Location‚Äù and system will create additional stage from the last delivery customer location in the original planning i.e. customer location ‚ÄúUSCU-SCE02‚Äù to loading location as shipping point location ‚ÄúSP_1710.

The item is assigned the cargo receipt status Delivery Failed. Later, a stage is created in a different or new freight document to represent the new delivery attempt.

C) Remove Freight Unit, Keep Items in Freight Document     

When this option is selected then system remove the freight unit from the freight order and this case re attempt delivery cost can not be calculated. Originally there are three freight units are linked to the freight order

After selecting the option‚Äù Remove Freight Unit, Keep Items in Freight Document ‚Äúit decouples the freight unit from the freight order as shown below.

entry.title: OData Deep Insert: Implementation and Real-Life Examples
entry.content:
Understanding OData Deep Insert in SAP: A Practical Overview

What is OData Deep Insert?

OData Deep Insert is used when we need to create a main record along with its related records in one go. For example, if we're creating a sales order and want to include multiple items in that order, instead of calling the service multiple times (once for the header and once for each item), we can just send everything together in one request. This helps reduce the number of API calls and keeps things more efficient.

Where Is It Used?

Let‚Äôs say we‚Äôre placing a new sales order:

  • The header contains information like the customer, order date, and total value.
  • The items include details such as product, quantity, and price.

With Deep Insert, we can send both the header and item data together in one single payload. This is useful in real-time integrations or web applications where performance and fewer network calls matter.

How to Implement It in SAP OData

  1. Define the Entity Model in SEGW

We‚Äôll need to create two entity types:

  • SalesOrder: Represents the header.
  • SalesOrderItem: Represents the line items.

Then create an association between them, showing that a sales order can have multiple items.

 

  1. Redefine CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY in DPC_EXT Class

This is where we will handle the payload in the backend.

METHOD create_deep_entity.
  DATA: ls_header_input  TYPE zcl_zdeep_demo_mpc=>ts_salesorder,
        lt_item_input    TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zcl_zdeep_demo_mpc=>ts_salesorderitem,
        ls_item_input    TYPE zcl_zdeep_demo_mpc=>ts_salesorderitem,
        ls_order_header  TYPE bapisdhd1,
        lt_items         TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapisditm,
        ls_item          TYPE bapisditm,
        lt_partners      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapiparnr,
        ls_partner       TYPE bapiparnr,
        lt_return        TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapiret2,
        ls_return        TYPE bapiret2,
        lv_salesdoc      TYPE vbak-vbeln.

  " Extract header & item data from payload
  ls_header_input = is_deep_entity.
  lt_item_input   = is_deep_entity-toitems.

  " Map header to BAPI structure
  ls_order_header-doc_type   = 'OR'.    " Order type
  ls_order_header-sales_org  = '1000'.
  ls_order_header-distr_chan = '10'.
  ls_order_header-division   = '00'.

  " Add Sold-to Party (AG)
  CLEAR ls_partner.
  ls_partner-partn_role = 'AG'.
  ls_partner-partn_numb = ls_header_input-customer.
  APPEND ls_partner TO lt_partners.

  " Optionally, Ship-to Party (WE) same as Sold-to
  CLEAR ls_partner.
  ls_partner-partn_role = 'WE'.
  ls_partner-partn_numb = ls_header_input-customer.
  APPEND ls_partner TO lt_partners.

  " Map item data
  LOOP AT lt_item_input INTO ls_item_input.
    CLEAR ls_item.
    ls_item-itm_number = ls_item_input-itemid.
    ls_item-material   = ls_item_input-material.
    ls_item-target_qty = ls_item_input-quantity.
    APPEND ls_item TO lt_items.
  ENDLOOP.

  " Call BAPI
  CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_SALESORDER_CREATEFROMDAT2'
    EXPORTING
      order_header_in  = ls_order_header
    IMPORTING
      salesdocument    = lv_salesdoc
    TABLES
      return           = lt_return
      order_items_in   = lt_items
      order_partners   = lt_partners.

  " Check for any errors (E/A/X)
  LOOP AT lt_return INTO ls_return WHERE type = 'E' OR 
                                         type = 'A' OR 
                                         type = 'X'.
    RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception
      EXPORTING
        textid  = /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception=>business_error
        message = ls_return-message.
  ENDLOOP.

  " Commit work
  CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT'
    EXPORTING
      wait = abap_true.
  " Fill deep entity response
  er_deep_entity-salesorderid = lv_salesdoc.
  er_deep_entity-customer     = ls_header_input-customer.
  er_deep_entity-orderdate    = ls_header_input-orderdate.

ENDMETHOD.

Make sure both header and items are saved in the same transaction to maintain consistency.

  1. Testing

We can test this service using Postman or /IWFND/GW_CLIENT in SAP. A sample payload might look like:

{
  "Customer": "1000001",
  "OrderDate": "2025-08-05T00:00:00",
  "ToItems":[{ "ItemID": "10",
               "Material": "MATERIAL001",
               "Quantity": 5 },
             { "ItemID": "20",
               "Material": "MATERIAL002",
               "Quantity": 3 } ]
}

 

Common Issues and Solutions

  • Items not saving?
    Check if the association and navigation are correctly defined.
  • CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY not triggered?
    Make sure you've redefined the method and mapped the navigation properly in SEGW.
  • Data inconsistency after commit?
    Handle errors correctly and roll back changes if needed.

Real-World Example

A retail company has a frontend ordering app. When a customer checks out, the app sends the order header and all items in one payload using Deep Insert. The backend saves everything in one shot, ensuring performance and data consistency.

In Summary

Deep Insert in OData is extremely helpful when dealing with parent-child relationships like orders and order items. It reduces complexity and improves performance by eliminating multiple round-trips to the server. When implemented correctly, it can streamline our data entry scenarios and backend integration.

entry.content:
Hello @Stone_Huang 

Thank you for your question.

Please note that within SAP HANA Public Cloud group reporting, the direct method cash flow statement organised by financial transaction type is not supported in the same manner as for individual reporting.

Company Individual Level

Group Reporting

¬∑         The cash flow statement can indeed be generated via the Financial Type option within the Financials module.

¬∑         The cash flow statement is organised based on consolidated transaction types.

¬∑         GR design employs its proprietary transaction type framework for consolidation.

 

Consequently, you cannot directly reuse the financial transaction cash flow logic from individual companies within group reporting.

Further details are provided via the following links:

Cash Flow Statement

Consolidation Financial Transaction Type

Transaction Data for Group Reporting - Read

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Customer on account payments Scope item 1S0 - SAP Dig...
entry.content:
Hello @Kunal_G 

 Thank you for your input and question. Others might be facing the same issue; the possible viable standard alternatives are below

Use SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Customer Payments (CCP). As you already mentioned, SAP will discontinue, and this is confirmed in the documentation below

Pay My Bills (customer selects and pays open items). SAP Help Portal-Enabling Make Ad Hoc Payments

Make Ad Hoc Payments (on-account payment when no invoice exists; payment methods are sourced from your CCP configuration). SAP Help Portal

Both can utilise the SAP Digital Payments add-on for card, e-check, and external methods when enabled.  SAP Help Portal-Enabling Payment Methods from SAP Digital Payments Add-On

PSP hosted page and automatic clearing in S/4 (no portal build)

Take the card payment on the PSP‚Äôs hosted page or virtual terminal with a structured reference; import via bank statement and auto-match using Manage Processing Rules ‚Äì For Bank Statements. Reprocess Bank Statement Items apps. SAP Help Portal-Manage Processing Rules - For Bank Statements

A very small internal BTP tile (not a full portal) Develop a lightweight UI that displays open AR items and facilitates payments via CCP APIs, triggering card capture through the Digital Payments add-on. API package: SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Customer Payments on SAP API Business Hub. SAP API-SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Customer Payments

Additional references you may require: Digital Payment Processes in Accounts Receivable (scope and prerequisites), DPA feature scope (direct capture and PSP integration). SAP Help Portal-Digital Payment Processes in Accounts Receivable

Recommendation: If you want a zero-custom UI today, opt for PSP-hosted capture and S/4 auto-clearing; if you need a single screen for representative, use the small BTP tile on the CCP and DPA APIs. (GenAI Assisted Content)

Let me know if you need further information

Thank you and best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to approve/reject tasks directly in SAP Mobile St...
entry.content:
Hello @yrjin 

Thank you for your question to the community.

In your described setup, the notifications are working correctly because mobile start is connected via SAP Build Work Zone and exposes the purchaser or purchasing manager roles.

The task UI must be enabled for my Inbox and integrated through the Task Center before the approve/reject actions can be executed. The redirection you are experiencing is the standard behaviour if you do not expose as an actionable item.

For the Task Center Integration, ensure it is set up in your BTP subaccount and connected. It exposed actionable workflow task to Mobile Start.

To configure your Inbox App, in addition to the earlier point, add the Build Work Zone app to the content you want to expose to Mobile Start.

Consult these references for more details.

SAP Mobile Start ‚Äì User Guide

Task Center in SAP Mobile Start

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Business area is not saved in Dispute Case ID
entry.content:
In SAP Dispute Management (FSCM), certain attributes in the dispute case (including Business Area) are derived from the linked FI/AR document. Standard background processes such as FDM_COLL_SEND_ITEMS, FDM_UPDATE_FROM_FI, or other periodic update reports ‚Äî re‚Äëread the source document and synchronise the dispute case attributes back to the original values. If you manually change the Business Area in the case, but the FI document still has the old Business Area, the next sync run will overwrite your change.

If the Business Area is wrong in the dispute case because it‚Äôs wrong in the accounting document, fix it at the source via FI document change if allowed, or reversal / re‚Äëposting. Once the FI document has the correct Business Area, the background sync will update the dispute case accordingly.

Please improve your code sample, some of it is bad practice:

Don¬¥t use getCore()

// don¬¥t use

// use

Messaging.registerObject()

In your samples don¬¥t use sap.ui.core

// "Message" required from module "sap/ui/core/message/Message"

    new Message({
        message: "Please fill all required fields.",
        type: MessageType.Error,
        target: "/field", // Optional: bind to a specific field

The SAP Databricks capability, fully native in the SAP Business Data Cloud solution, brings scalable AI and ML to enterprise data.
This session covers the sharing of Data Products and enriching them with new ML insights, thereby utilizing out-of-the-box tooling for data scientists of SAP Databricks.
 
Speaker

entry.title: Re: Planning File Entries Conversion and post validation...
entry.content:
Hello @amitkathayat 

Check the note 2268088 - S4TWL - Planning File that details the setup and conversion reports.

You only need to use PPH_*_SIMU reports if you use long term planning, which is rarely the case from my experience.

Be sure to apply all correction notes related to the PPH_SETUP_MRPRECORDS, PPH_SETUP_MRPRECORDS_SIMU, PPH_CONVERT_MRPRECORDS and PPH_CONVERT_MRPRECORDS_SIMU reports beforehand.

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: üîµ The SAP Generative AI Hub plug-in for LiteLLM
entry.content:
LiteLLM is an open-source Python library designed to standardize and simplify interactions with multiple large language model (LLM) providers through a unified interface. By abstracting the complexities of different API endpoints, authentication methods, and response formats, LiteLLM enables developers to seamlessly switch between providers such as OpenAI, Anthropic, Hugging Face, and others with minimal code changes.
The SAP GenAI Hub plug-in for LiteLLM provides the option to use various LLM / Agentic libraries to leverage theLLMs available in SAP's GenAI Hub by taking care of the login via BTP credentials.

Speaker

  • Karim Mohraz

entry.title: üîµ Want better RAG results? Optimize your Data
entry.content:
In the evolving landscape of AI, improving Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) results is crucial. A key challenge in LLM training is the dwindling availability of high-quality, human-generated data. While more data is often seen as beneficial, in practice, irrelevant and noisy data can in fact negatively impact performance. Recent research highlights the advantages of Selective Language Modeling (SLM) in pretraining LLMs. In one study, selecting specific tokens during pretraining can substantially reduce downstream loss and enhance model performance. As part of the Enterprise AI Search team at SAP, we have access to extensive indexed data from internal and external sources such as SAP Help and Community documents to name a few. By leveraging these insights, we aim to refine token selection strategies, improving RAG efficiency and model effectiveness, and in short get the most out of our existing data.

Speaker

  • Ceylin Ozdemir

entry.title: Approach for a multi-site customer service
entry.content:
Dear all, SAP Commerce offers OOTB customer service, which is a customized backoffice defined in the file
hybris/bin/modules/customer-service/customersupportbackoffice/resources/customersupportbackoffice-backoffice-config.xml
of the customersupportbackoffice extension for the roles customersupportadministratorrole, customersupportmanagerrole, and customersupportagentrole.

Now, let‚Äôs suppose we want to use the CS cockpit in 2 different sites and, for example, we want to display different tabs or different data in orders or other types of data, since these sites sell products with different typologies.

The data visibility for one site or another I can easily solve by creating different SiteEmployeeGroups for site1 and site2, but the challenge lies in the part of having different views.

My first idea was to create new roles extending customersupportadministratorrole, customersupportmanagerrole, and customersupportagentrole. For example: site1customersupportadministratorrole, site1customersupportmanagerrole, site1customersupportagentrole, and site2customersupportadministratorrole, site2customersupportmanagerrole, site2customersupportagentrole. But if I‚Äôm not mistaken, this does not work because there is no inheritance at the UI visualization level, unlike what happens at the data level with access rights.

So I would like to know what would be the best approach for this case. What comes to mind is copying the entire configuration from
hybris/bin/modules/customer-service/customersupportbackoffice/resources/customersupportbackoffice-backoffice-config.xml
for the new roles (site1customersupportadministratorrole, site1customersupportmanagerrole, site1customersupportagentrole and site2customersupportadministratorrole, site2customersupportmanagerrole, site2customersupportagentrole) and customizing each of them from there, but I‚Äôm not sure if there is a better approach.

Thanks.

entry.title: Re: SAP ByD- Technical field name for columns with descri...
entry.content:
Hello,

 

If your intention is to find the technical name / IDs of the fields in the report, this can be done by
Business analytics - Design reports - Search for report
Click on Build OData query.
in the Attributes tab, you can find the EDM IDs and Attribute ID.

For example :  G/L Accounts - Line Items reprot

Here you will find cost center as one of the attribute in report,

when you are looking at the build odata query screen,

you will find that Cost center ID as well as Description both has the same attribute ID : COST_CTR_UUID, however EDM IDs are diferent
CCOST_CTR_UUID for ID
TCOST_CTR_UUID for Description

general naming convention in EDM is
C****** = ID
T****** = Name / Description
K****** = Key Figure
F****** = Formatted Key figure
R****** = Currency Code
U****** = Unit associated with the key figure ( only if key figure is quantiity based)

hope this helps.

Thanks,
Harshal

entry.title: Looking for Documentation on ADT (ABAP Development Tools) API Endpoints
entry.content: Hello everyone, I'm currently working on integrating with SAP systems using ADT (ABAP Development Tools) APIs and have been exploring various endpoints exposed by the ADT service. While I've identified several API paths through XML metadata (such as those related to repository information systems, debugger controls, Web Dynpro components, and abapGit repositories), I'm struggling to find comprehensive official documentation that details: 1.The full list of available ADT API endpoints and their purposes 2.Required request parameters, headers, and body formats for each endpoint 3.Authentication/authorization requirements (e.g., supported OAuth scopes, session handling) 4.Response structures and error codes 5.Versioning information and compatibility notes For example, I've come across endpoints like /sap/bc/adt/repository/informationsystem/search (for object search) and /sap/bc/adt/debugger/watchpoints (for debugger controls), but I need more details on how to properly invoke and interact with them. Could anyone point me to official SAP documentation, guides, or resources that cover these ADT APIs in detail? Any insights from community members who have worked with these APIs would also be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Error when using the new App "Import Master Data - Business Partners"
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
i wanted to utilize the new Apps "Export Master Data - Business Partners (New)" (F6551A) and "Import Master Data - Business Partners (New)" (F6553A).
What i did was, i selected a Business Partner with all tables exported it as an XML and then unlocked the file in Exel so it could be edited. I then tried to just import it into another tenant without a source system, but during the creation of this Import process, the process gets stuck on the status "Importing file" . Also the file i uploaded starts to flicker, so it disappears for a second in the ui and then appears again and this goes on for ever. 

So my question is, is this error/bug specific to our system or did i miss some important step in the process of exporting and importing ?

Best regards 
Lukas

entry.title: Re: Automatic Posting to Account Foreign exchange gain re...
entry.content: The posting of the 72,952.13 LKR to account 50162050 (Foreign Ex Gain Real) is an automatic posting made by the SAP system. This is a key standard feature of SAP's Financial Accounting (FI) module, specifically in its handling of foreign currency transactions and clearing

entry.title: Re: Introducing new type of Data Access Control "Operator and Value" for SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
@erik_pedersen 

In your example 1 you added an AND Condition (because both are Restriction 1) for PROFIT_CTR meaning it has to be 0081101500  and 0081301000 at the same time. Since in your data it is probably never both at the same time the Result is empty.

In your exmaple 2 you made it an OR Condition (because Restrition 1 & Restriction 2) for PROFIT_CTR.
So whenever you have mutliple Conditions for the same Column you should use a OR Condition (mutliple Restrictions numbers) otherwise the Result will always be emtpy.

entry.title: Re: Map format data field FPAYHX-REF01
entry.content:
Hello @yk21 

Thanks for reaching out. In response to your questions, below are some helpful SAP official documentation for public use.

What is FPAYHX-REF01? It is an extra reference slot at the header level within the payment medium data model. It‚Äôs not populated by default, SAP Help Portal-Including Custom Reference Fields

To populate it, follow these steps in Cloud-safe in Custom Fields and Logic, SAP Help Portal, including Custom Reference Fields

Map Format Data for Payments. SAP Help Portal-Map Format Data for Payments

Create a payment file and confirm in Payment Media ‚Üí Display File. SAP Community: Analyse the Processing of Outgoing Payment Files from Map Format Data

About the tcodes mentioned earlier, those are on-premises configuration tools and not used in Public Cloud. For the S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, payment-format mapping is done with the Map Format Data for Payments app and other configuration activities are done via SSCUI/CBC activities, no tcodes in Public cloud

With best regards

Chuma
